title: Honey Curry Sole Fillet
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Honey Curry Sole Fillet a try. This recipe serves 1 and costs $16.93 per serving. One portion of this dish contains about 95g of protein, 77g of fat, and a total of 1461 calories. If you have sole, butter, cilantro, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the butter you could follow this main course with the Cinnamon Butter Cake as a dessert. Not a lot of people really liked this Indian dish. It is brought to you by Recipezaar. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, primal, and pescatarian diet. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. Overall, this recipe earns a solid spoonacular score of 64%. Similar recipes are Fillet of Sole in an Oil Sauce, Mykonos Fillet of Sole, and Fillet of Sole Florentine.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are great choices for Fish. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. You could try Chehalem 3 Vineyard Pinot Gris. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 26 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Chehalem 3 Vineyard Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: A blend of three great vineyards, this vivid grape crafts a food-friendly wine, bright and pure. Gray it isn't. The knife-edged acid, with pear, lemon sorbet, spice and jasmine makes your mouth water and your hands shake.

instructions: oven preheated 350F degrees.combine honey, mustard, curry,& butter in small bowl; mix well.lightly butter shallow baker; add sole fillets, slightly overlapping is good.Top side up.pour curry sauce on top; bake (uncovered) for 15-20 minutes.serve warm, with cilantro and roasted almond pieces on top.MM!

steps.step: oven preheated 350F degrees.combine honey, mustard, curry,& butter in small bowl; mix well.lightly butter shallow baker; add sole fillets, slightly overlapping is good.Top side up.pour curry sauce on top; bake (uncovered) for 15-20 minutes.serve warm, with cilantro and roasted almond pieces on top.MM!
